newsitem.title: USA: Bradley sees $150 mln acquisition goal.
newsitem.headline: Bradley sees $150 mln acquisition goal.

text.p: Bradley Real Estate Inc said Monday it expects to achieve its 1997 acquisition goal of $150 million.

"We are currently in varying stages of negotiations of numerous transactions and expect that these negotiations will result in completed transactions in coming quarters," Thomas D'Arcy, president, said in a statement.
Earlier, Bradley, a real estate investment trust, reported first quarter funds from operations of $0.44 a share, up from $0.33 a year ago.

Property occupancy was 90 percent at March 31, the same as at December 31. During the quarter, the company said, it signed 12 new leases totaling 96,000 square feet at an average rate of $7.37 per square foot.
In addition, the company renewed 17 leases totaling 74,000 square feet at an average rate of $11.27 per square foot, up nine percent.

Subsequent to the first quarter, Bradley purchased an additional Midwest grocery-anchored center, Spring Village, in Davenport, Iowa. The 92,000-square-foot community shopping center is 98 percent leased.
Spring Village was purchased for $4.6 million.
